properties.areaDesc: Lewis, WV; Ritchie, WV; Doddridge, WV; Pleasants, WV; Tyler, WV; Harrison, WV
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 13 at 1:51PM EST until February 13 at 8:15PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston has extended the

* Flood Warning for urban areas and small streams in...
Doddridge County in northern West Virginia...
Southwestern Harrison County in northern West Virginia...
North Central Lewis County in northern West Virginia...
Tyler County in northern West Virginia...
Northeastern Pleasants County in northwestern West Virginia...
Northeastern Ritchie County in northwestern West Virginia...

* Until 815 PM EST Thursday.

* At 151 PM EST, Rain from yesterday, overnight and this morning has
caused streams, creeks and rivers to rise and come out of their
banks in spots. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly
in the warning area.

At 1:25 PM EST, the stage at Middlebourne on Middle Island Creek was
16.72 feet.  The estimated flood stage is 16 feet.  Middle Island
Creek at Middlebourne is in crest and will start a slow fall later
this afternoon.  At stages near 16 feet, the field next to gage
floods. Low and poor drainage areas along Middle Island Creek and
tributaries start to flood.

At 1:30 PM EST, the stage at Little on the Middle Island Creek was
13.58 feet. The estimated flood stage at Little is 14 feet. At
stages near 14 feet, the field opposite the gage as well as Stewarts
Run Road are flooded. The Creek will rise to around 14 feet and then
start a slow fall later this afternoon.

Some locations that will experience flooding include...
St. Marys, Middlebourne, Salem, Sistersville, Pennsboro, West Union,
Alma, Canton, Lima, Smithburg, Greenwood, Blandville, Wick, Center
Point, New Milton, Hebron, Sedalia, Avon, Arvilla and Point Lookout.

This includes the following streams and drainages...
Pratt Run, Slider Run, Middle Fork Mudlick Run, Right Fork Arnold
Creek, Buffalo Run, Tenmile Run, Shawnee Run, Jefferson Run, Hog
Camp Run, Toms Fork, Burntcabin Run, Bunnell Run, Nutter Fork, Lick
Run, Jacob Run, Sheets Run, Elklick Run, Dry Run, Brushy Fork, Halls
Run, Fink Creek, Bonds Creek, Muddy Creek, Hunter Fork, Sugar Creek,
Piggin Run, Indian Fork, Brush Run, Sand Fork, Beverlin Fork, Hills
Run, Cherrycamp Run, South Fork Hughes River, Middle Island Creek,
Meathouse Fork, Foster Run, Bens Run, Grouse Run, Xddox Run,
Ferguson Run, Saltlick Run, Jacobs Run, Josephs Fork, Cabin Run,
Woodburn Run, Little Flint Run, Rock Run, Left Fork French Creek,
ElkLick Run, Sunfish Run, Dotson Run, Coburn Fork, Kincheloe Creek,
Isaacs Creek, Poplarlick Run, Tanner Fork, McKim Creek, Turkey Run,
Big Isaac Creek, Narrows Run, Gorrell Run, Indian Run, Robinson
Fork, Big Run, Indian Creek, Beech Run, Smoke Camp Run, Ohio River,
McElroy Creek, Wheeler Run, Roberts Fork, Tenmile Creek, Buck Run,
Walnut Fork, Little Battle Run, Pike Fork, Left Prong Skelton Run,
Long Run, Grimms Run, Talkington Run, Camp Run, Flint Run, Whiskey
Run, Leason Run, Isarel Fork, Rush Fork, North Fork Hughes River,
Little Toms Fork, Middle Run, Conaway Run, Danas Run, Arnold Creek,
Cave Run, Big Battle Run, Badger Run, Spring Run and Salem Run.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
